thread.section_title: The Wall Street Journal & Breaking News, Business, Financial and Economic News, World News and Video
thread.title: In a Tepid Free-Agent Market, Baseball Teams Still Need Relief

author: Jared Diamond
title: In a Tepid Free-Agent Market, Baseball Teams Still Need Relief
text:
It wasn’t a good winter to be a baseball free agent. Star players discovered a bloc of front offices unwilling to meet their contract expectations. Second-tier players struggled to find a home at all. Even now, with spring training games well underway across the Grapefruit and Cactus Leagues, dozens of major-leaguers remain available, some working out at a union-sponsored camp in Bradenton, Fla.
But there was one notable—and perhaps surprising—exception to the free-agent freeze-out: pitchers who throw one inning at a time.
...
